case_vignette: A 28-year-old man presents with a yellow coloration of his skin. He says he feels well and denies any recent history of nausea, fatigue or fever, or discoloration of his urine or stool. The patient reports episodes with similar symptoms in the past. Family history is significant for similar symptoms in his father. The patient is afebrile and vital signs are within normal limits. On physical examination, he is jaundiced. Scleral icterus is present. Laboratory findings are significant only for an unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia. Liver enzymes are normal, and there is no bilirubin present in the urine.
question: Which  is the most appropriate treatment for this patient’s most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a yellow coloration of my skin.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as abdominal pain, fever, or fatigue?
No, I haven't had any abdominal pain, fever, or fatigue recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or weight?
No, I haven't had any changes in my appetite or weight.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or medical history?
I haven't had any recent changes in my medication or medical history.
Have you had any family history of liver disease or jaundice?
Yes, my father had similar symptoms to what I'm experiencing.
Final Diagnosis: Hereditary Hemochromatosis.
